text: well back in 2013 the Sydney Swans AFL
star Adam Goodes was called an 8 by a 13
year old spectator at the Melbourne
Cricket Ground have a young girl later
phoned goods to apologise but the
incident sparked a media storm with
goods accused of singling out the young
girl and dragging her into the limelight
while crowds started booing him wherever
he got the ball good suffered mentally
but he stayed strong on the pitch and
even performed an Aboriginal war cry
during the AFL's indigenous round in May
earlier this year it's snowballed into a
national debate on race relations and
has drastically divided Australians into
two camps of thoughts those booing him
think Goods is pushing his anti racism
stats too much into the public's face
those in support of the 2014 Australian
of the Year a vocal critics of racism in
sport and in society and are using
social media hashtags devoted to goods
like hash tag solidarity and hashtag
stand by Adam now Hollywood celebrities
like Cate Blanchett Hugh Jackman and
Hugo Weaving
have also sent messages of support and
Australians around the world are posting
photographs of themselves with goods as
playing number 37 the two-time AFL
premiership winner is set to take to the
field again in Saturday's clash with the
Geelong cats and is grateful for the
support he's received the last week
there's been a lot of discussion a lot
of it I haven't read by obviously been
involved in before and I think those
discussions needed to be had and I'm
really hopeful that those discussions
are behind us now we can all move on I
think people have had their opinions
they've spoken about the issues and
hopefully now we can move forward
Geelong and the AFL Players Association
have urged their fans to report those
who continue to boo Goods when the
Sydney Swans champion makes his return
on Saturday night Australians around the
world will be watching
